plugins.name: Falcon
plugins.description:
Falcon is an experimental ChatGPT powered Figma plugin that allows you to quickly search for layers using natural language descriptions.


Simply make a selection, then describe a condition that each layer has to follow to remain selected. The plugin will apply that filter to every layer you've selected, and optionally to every child as well, streamlining your workflow and saving you time.


No one likes searching through layers to manually select a bunch of layers in a messy figma file. Now you don't have to.


You'll just need an OpenAI API key to get started, which you can get here after making an account.


Tips:

  • Be descriptive: It's more likely to get you what you want if you're descriptive and specific. It's powered by ChatGPT so if you've used that before, write in a similar way.
  • It doesn't know what you've selected: As a measure to both increase privacy and reduce token usage, I've built it to not rely on knowing what you've got selected, so don't write any rules that expect it to have that understanding. For example, don't write "is the name of an animal" (I tried it once to see what would happen and it tried to make a list of every animal to make a comparison, and it hit the token limit so didn't finish.)
  • It does some things really well, and other things not at all: It currently struggles with vague references to colors and gradients. If you want to query those, be specific, i.e. don't say "is red", instead use a hex code, list of hex codes/rgba/hsla etc or describe a range of values that should pass. For gradients, "has a gradient" doesn't work reliably. Instead, say something like "has a linear gradient fill".


This is still very much an experimental plugin, so expect it to not work perfectly every single time. My twitter DMs are open if you encounter any issues though.
plugins.tagline: Filter and select layers by describing what you want

52692.release_notes: slight improvements to description understanding, especially when not following the format of describing via a pass/fail condition, and instead describing a group, so now saying things like "numbers bigger than 5" is more easily understood, though it would still be preferable to use the condition version: "is a number bigger than 5"

plugins.name: Polipo — Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real time.
plugins.description:
Complex designs, happy developers.


Implement any design in just a few lines of code.

Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real-time.


Works with: Figma, React, Next.js, Remix, Gatsby, HTML5 and CSS3.


Go to polipo.io to learn about Polipo and book a demo, or watch our video.


The 1st Figma Compiler

Polipo runs on the developer’s computer and compiles Figma designs instantly into HTML and responsive CSS, rendered via React.


Here is how to use Polipo:


1. Create a design

Design a screen or component, with a single or multiple variants


2. Connect it to code

Customize responsiveness, sizing, hover states, and more


3. Add logic with React

Add custom tags, attributes, event listeners or dynamic data


4. Develop and iterate

Design changes are reflected in the product instantly


5. Build for production

Export everything from Figma without leaving the command line


6. Your product is live

Deploy optimized and responsive HTML/CSS with your React logic


Web development, just great

Deliver sooner, keeping both designers and developers engaged.

Get the best out of your team.


Real-time Figma Synchronization

Preview design changes instantly in your browser, thanks to our real-time Figma synchronization. Every adjustment in Figma is reflected in your web application in less than 1s, making collaboration truly seamless.


Single Source of Truth

Polipo ensures that your design and your product stay perfectly aligned. Figma becomes the single source of truth for layouts and visual, while code stays the single source of truth for interactions, data flow and logic. You no longer have to worry about outdated components or conflicting versions.


No Generated Code

Polipo isn’t a code generator – it’s a compiler. It takes Figma designs along with your handcrafted code to produce optimized HTML and CSS on the fly. Say goodbye to maintaining mountains of auto-generated code, and focus on what really matters.


Launch Today, not in Months

Turn a complex design into a live application in just a few seconds. You can go from design to deployment in a single day, launching products that are visually stunning and completely on-brand – without months-long delays.


Seamless Collaboration

Designers and developers work together from day one. No more time-consuming hand-offs: every update made in Figma can be automatically synchronized with your product, allowing both teams to iterate without friction.


Loved by Developers

Polipo puts developers in control. Specify exactly which elements to extract from Figma and how to make them dynamic, and export optimized code right from the command line. Developers retain the flexibility to tweak and customize every detail.


Pixel-perfect, effortlessly.

With Polipo, even the most intricate designs are rendered exactly as intended, without disrupting your codebase. Designers no longer need to compromise their vision to meet development requirements, and can just focus on creating stunning designs.


Responsive by Design

Responsiveness is crafted directly in Figma. Designers can use auto-layout, variants, variables, and breakpoints to ensure their designs adapt beautifully across all screen sizes. Polipo automatically compiles this logic into a unified markup and responsive CSS.


Focus on Logic, not Pixels

Developers can focus on the core logic and business-critical functionality of your applications, without getting bogged down in design details. Polipo handles the pixel-perfect translation, leaving you to concentrate on the data and interactions.


Predictable and Reliable

Polipo’s algorithm guarantees accuracy. It doesn’t rely on AI, so you can trust it to generate correct, optimized code every single time. It’s designed to run locally and quickly, giving developers full control over the process while ensuring a reliable output.


Keep your Data Safe

Polipo runs entirely on your local machine, meaning your design files and code never leave your environment. This ensures complete control and protection of your sensitive data. Ideal for enterprises requiring high levels of security and compliance.


Flexible for Any Project

Whether you're building a landing page, an e-commerce platform, or a complex enterprise application, Polipo speeds up your workflow, helping you deliver faster without compromising quality.


Simple pricing for everyone

Polipo doubles the productivity of your team, at a fixed price.

Go to polipo.io to check our pricing.


Frequently Asked Questions

Here are the answers to the most common questions from our clients.


What is the quality of the compiled code?

Polipo compiles efficient markup and CSS, optimizing the HTML by removing duplicates and redundant elements, even when components have multiple variants in Figma. The compiled CSS uses selectors and media queries effectively, adapting the design to different screen sizes, color schemes, hover states, and more. Since Polipo focuses on producing target code — not source code — there's no need for you to maintain it, allowing us to prioritize speed and accuracy.


What about responsive design?

Responsiveness is built directly into Figma using auto-layout, breakpoints, and variants. Developers can refine responsiveness further with custom CSS when needed.


What happens in production?

To deploy for staging or production, the compiled markup and CSS are exported and added to your codebase via Git. In production mode, there is no longer any connection to Figma or Polipo, same as a traditional code-based implementation. New design changes in Figma are not automatically reflected in production until they are deployed by a developer.


What are people building with Polipo?

Polipo can be used for all web-based products based on Figma designs. Our most common use case is building marketing and e-commerce websites with a high level of customization and dynamic or CMS-provided data. The most common framework used with Polipo is Next.js.


Can I use it for prototyping?

Yes! Polipo makes prototyping faster by quickly turning your designs into live applications. You can use the prototype as a foundation for your final product or switch to a traditional development approach later, depending on your needs.


What is the runtime overhead?

None. The generation of markup and CSS happens at build time. In production, markup is rendered via a direct translation to JSX, with negligible runtime cost.


Is it optimized for SEO?

Yes. Polipo gives developers full control over SEO by allowing them to customize semantic markup, including tag names and attributes.


What about workflow, CI/CD, and versioning?

Figma designs are treated like traditional assets (images, SVGs, fonts, etc.). Compiled markup and CSS are versioned in Git alongside your application code and can be processed by CI/CD pipelines. Figma files themselves can be managed through native Figma branching and versioning or with a manual workflow.


Does it use AI?

No, our code generation is completely procedural.


Which frameworks do you support?

We support React, Next.js, Remix, and Gatsby. We also have preview versions for Vue.js and Angular, supported on a project-by-project basis.


Do you provide support?

Yes, we offer dedicated support for teams. Contact our sales team to learn more about our support options.


Need to move fast?

Go to polipo.io and book a demo or watch our video.

plugins.name: Copy That
plugins.description:
Manage your copy magically using Figma Variables.


We've all been there.

Your developer looks at the android and iOS versions of your screen, and tells you the copy doesn't match the web version. It should. You would normally despair as you painstakingly update each text layer individually and pray you didn't miss something else.


Despair NO MORE!


This plugin will help your copy stay in sync between screens, and makes updating that copy a breeze!


Import text as Figma variables right from your Figma frames. Then link other text layers to those variables so that when you update that variable, all your text layers get updated automatically and never go out of sync.


This does NOT require a paid version of Figma - will work with the free version.


Happy Figma-ing!


Brad

accepted.name: Brad Judd
accepted.description: I'm a designer at Turo. Always tinkering.

plugins.tagline: Your brain for managing copy in Figma

plugins.name: 画板命名工具 Frame Rename
plugins.description:
画板管理大师: 画板管理工具

CanvasMaster Pro: Comprehensive Canvas Management Plugin for Figma


通过画板管理大师，这款功能强大的插件，提升您的 Figma 使用体验。它支持画板命名、批量导出大图、添加顺序前缀、重命名及撤销操作，极大提升了设计效率和精确度。


Enhance your Figma experience with CanvasMaster Pro, a powerful plugin designed to streamline canvas management. It supports naming canvases, batch exporting large images, adding order prefixes, renaming, and undo operations, significantly enhancing design efficiency and precision.


功能特性：

  1. 生成画板命名文字：自动为画板生成命名，方便管理。
  2. 增加画板顺序前缀：按顺序为画板添加前缀，使画板排列更加有序。
  3. 重命名画板/分组：批量重命名画板或分组，简化命名流程。
  4. 命名替换：快速搜索并替换画板或分组的名称。
  5. 清除命名文字：一键清除所选画板的命名文字。
  6. 清除顺序前缀：一键清除所选画板的顺序前缀。
  7. 导出图片工具：支持导出自带边距或无边距的大图，方便展示和分享。
  8. 操作撤销：对画板操作进行撤销，减少误操作的影响。


Features:

  1. Generate Canvas Names: Automatically generate names for canvases for easy management.
  2. Add Order Prefix: Add sequential prefixes to canvases for better organization.
  3. Rename Canvas/Groups: Batch rename canvases or groups to simplify the naming process.
  4. Name Replacement: Quickly search and replace names of canvases or groups.
  5. Clear Naming Text: Clear naming text of selected canvases with one click.
  6. Clear Order Prefix: Clear order prefixes of selected canvases with one click.
  7. Image Export Tool: Export large images with or without margins for easy display and sharing.


Undo Operations: Undo canvas operations to reduce the impact of mistakes.


非常适合希望简化工作流程并在不同设备大小上实现一致设计结果的设计师和团队。


Perfect for designers and teams looking to streamline their workflow and achieve consistent design results across different device sizes.


立即获取画板管理大师，前所未有地掌控您的设计管理！


Get CanvasMaster Pro today and take control of your canvas management like never before!

plugins.name: Frame Multiplier with Custom Text
plugins.description:
With this plugin you will be able to generate n Frames from a "Frame template", in addition you will be able to establish different text values for each one of these.


It is recommended that before executing the plugin, clear names are established for the text fields that they want to modify, so that their identification is easy (step 2), each value goes on a line within the textarea.


If you set a number of values greater than 1 for more than one text field, then they must have the same number of values or lines.


With this plugin you will be able to:

  • Generate a batch of certificates, diplomas, etc.
  • Copy or duplicate a frame n times.
  • Set custom names for each generated frame.
plugins.tagline: This plugin allows you multiply a Frame n times and be able to set custom text values for each one.

51012.name: Frame Multiplier with Custom Text
51012.description:
With this plugin you will be able to generate n Frames from a "Frame template", in addition you will be able to establish different text values for each one of these.


It is recommended that before executing the plugin, clear names are established for the text fields that they want to modify, so that their identification is easy (step 2), each value goes on a line within the textarea.


If you set a number of values greater than 1 for more than one text field, then they must have the same number of values or lines.


With this plugin you will be able to:

  • Generate a batch of certificates, diplomas, etc.
  • Copy or duplicate a frame n times.
  • Set custom names for each generated frame.
51012.tagline: This plugin allows you multiply a Frame n times and be able to set custom text values for each one.

Adeliom WebComponents - For Figma is a dedicated plugin designed for enhancing the workflow of Figma users, especially in development mode. This tool is engineered to streamline the design-to-code transition, crucial for modern web development.


Key Features


  1. Variable Extraction: Extracts design variables directly from Figma files.
  2. Format Conversion: Transforms these variables into CSS and JSON formats, ensuring seamless integration.
  3. Compatibility with AWC: Specifically tailored to be fully compatible with Adeliom WebComponents (AWC) design systems.


Benefits


  1. Efficiency in Design Workflow: Significantly reduces the time and effort needed to convert design elements into usable code.
  2. Seamless Integration: Facilitates an effortless transition of design elements into the AWC ecosystem, maintaining design integrity and consistency.
  3. Bridging Design and Development: Ideal for teams seeking a cohesive workflow between designers and developers.


Use Cases

  2. UI/UX Design: Assists designers in visualizing how their designs will translate into actual web components.


Demo & Learn More

AutoLayout is great, I spend all day using it. But I need an easier way to switch between spacing modes. Usually- I have to move my cursor, click a dropdown, and click. Definetly a hack, but still useful!!

plugins.name: Cite
plugins.description:
The Cite plugin allows you to add citations from Zotero to your Figma files and FigJam boards. You must have a Zotero account, an API Key, and be online to use the plugin.


To search your private libraries, you'll need to provide the plugin your Zotero User ID and API Key.


Once you’ve added your keys, you can search for anything in your Zotero library. The plugin will return a list of titles and authors. You can select an item from the search results and add it to your layout.


How to use


1. Get your User ID

  • Go to zotero.org/settings/keys and copy your userid. Run the plugin and paste your userid into the plugin’s User ID field.


2. Create an API Key

  • Go back to zotero.org/settings/keys and click “Create new private key”.
  • Fill out the form. Make sure “Allow library access” and “Read Only” are enabled. Click “Save Key.”
  • Copy the key from the green box. Paste the key into the plugin’s API Key field. Click the “Save Keys” button in the plugin.


3. Search your Zotero library

  •  In the plugin, enter a keyword into the search field (e.g., cats) and select an item from the list of search results.


4. Add the selected item to your Figma or FigJam layout

  • Confirm your selection and generate the citation.


Note: The plugin saves your credentials locally, so you do not need to enter this information every time you use it. However, you may need re-enter your credentials if you clear your cache. The plugin does not store your credentials anywhere on the web.


Feedback

How do you use this plugin? How would you like to use it? Any and all feedback is welcome. You can add comments as sticky notes to this FigJam board.


Roadmap

Future enhancements will be based on user feedback. A few ideas:

  • Add notes to a citation
  • Export an image of a source
  • Include tags from sources
  • Create a bibliography


Contribute

If you’d like to help develop this plugin, feel free to submit an issue or pull request. Code contributors should fork the repo and create a working branch for new changes. Once you’ve made changes, you can create a pull request for review.


GitHub repo: https://github.com/jamescoledesign/cite


Some useful guides for contributors:

  • Zotero Web API documentation
  • Figma Plugin API documentation
  • Example contribution guide: GitHub docs contributing guide


Contact

citeplugin@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Add citations from Zotero to your Figma and FigJam layouts

plugins.name: i18n with variables
plugins.description:
i18n with variables plugin can help you establish a Translation Management or Content Review System right within Figma with Figma String variable.


Problems to solve

One useful use case for Figma String variable is design localization or content review (like mentioned in this Youtube video) , but they come with certain drawbacks that this plugin aims to solve.

  1. Creating variables, and attaching variables to text layers is very time consuming for a large design file or a complex prototype
  2. Difficulty in identifying text layers that are without attached variables later on
  3. Not easy to create variables in bulk


Features

  1. Display all visible text under a Figma layer as an editable table
  2. Create and assign variables for each text with ease
  3. Auto create variables in bulk
  4. Search and filter the table to quickly identify a text layer that needs to be assigned a new or existing variable
  5. Import and export the text and variables
  6. Remove unused variables


Playground file

Please see the playground file for more tutorials!


Contact

If you have any questions or feature suggestions, feel free to leave a comment!

plugins.name: File Health Check
plugins.description:
Evaluate the quality of your design file following various criteria.


Criteria are currently the following

Design system related :

  • Component tagged with “deprecated” within their description
  • Elements not using stylings
  • Autolayouts not using spacings on a 8 px grid

Design related :

  • Unnamed layers
  • Groups / Frames that have only 1 element (and no stylings)

plugins.name: Batch Frame Creator
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create and customize Figma frames with specified dimensions and names using this plugin.


Introducing my latest plugin, a personal endeavor aimed at streamlining frame creation like never before. With just a single click, you can now batch-create an infinite number of frames, significantly reducing the time and effort required compared to traditional methods.


Key Features:


  • Unlimited frame creation
  • Optional frame naming for precise organization
  • Customizable frame sizes (height and width)
  • How to Use:


Upon opening the plugin, you'll find two sections of settings:


Frame Settings:


  • Specify the number of frames you wish to add.
  • Optionally name each frame for meticulous management.


Size Settings:


  • Set the width and height for all frames simultaneously.


Please Note: In this version, size adjustments apply universally to all frames.


I'm open to your suggestions and eager to hear about any additional features you'd like to see or modifications you suggest. Your feedback is invaluable to me, so please don't hesitate to reach out or comment.

plugins.name: Commentify
plugins.description:
The ultimate plugin for maximizing the utility of comments in Figma


Commentify goes beyond basic annotation tools—it's your indispensable ally for managing layer annotations seamlessly in Figma. With it, chaotic comment threads are transformed into organized hubs of productivity.


What can you achieve with Commentify?


  • Streamlined annotations: effortlessly create and manage annotations. Categorize your comments based on various aspects (poeditor, accessibility and analytics).
  • Enhanced portability: stop losing comments when relocating Figma files. Commentify ensures your annotations travel with you.
  • Instant access: access team members' comments directly from the left sidebar menu. Commentify swiftly directs you to pertinent information.
  • Developer mode compatibility: integrate commentify into your development workflow.


Commentify is the tool you've been searching for to elevate communication and collaboration in your Figma design projects.

plugins.description:
Are you tired of the time-consuming and error-prone process of turning your Figma designs into functional UI? Look no further, because IO Craft is here to revolutionize your design-to-code journey! 


Why IO Craft? 

Atomic Design:  

Embrace principles of atomic design, enabling designers to assemble reusable components systematically to build better platforms. 

Accessibility and Reusability:  

Focus on accessibility standards, ensuring that your platforms are designed with inclusivity in mind, while also promoting reusability across projects. 

Multi team enablement:  

Foster collaboration and alignment among designers, developers, and stakeholders, ensuring a unified approach to design and development. 

Standardization across platforms:  

Establish design standards and guidelines, promoting consistency and efficiency throughout the design and development process while building multiple platforms. 


Why IO Craft Plugin? 

Effortless Theme Extraction:  

Automates the process of extracting colors and typography elements from your Figma designs, saving you valuable time and eliminating the need for manual searching 

 

Automated Widget Generation:

Pixel-Perfect Consistency:

plugins.name: String-along
plugins.description:
Simplify content collaboration with a few clicks!


String-along makes managing string variables in your design projects a breeze, and with the release of version 2.0, we're taking your content collaboration to new heights. Building on our robust variable export and import capabilities, String-along 2.0 introduces a comprehensive suite of new features designed to enhance your workflow in Figma even further.


What's New in Version 2.0:


  • Advanced Manage Tab: A standout feature of 2.0, the Manage tab brings full string management to Figma. It automatically loads and categorizes all text elements on your current page, grouping them by their root frame for easy access, search, and more.


  • Text Node Search: Within the Manage tab, a unified fuzzy search feature allows you to filter by text content or variable name.


  • String Annotations: Add a status annotation to any text element, with options for both silent and visual annotations to suit your workflow needs. Then you can group the text nodes on the current page based on its annotated status.


  • Edit Text Nodes: Through the manage tab, you can edit text nodes, writing custom copy, or attaching them to existing or new string variables. This feature significantly enhances the plugin's utility for managing dynamic content across your projects and maximizes your ability to take advantage of string variables in Figma.


  • Bulk Editing: String-along 2.0 introduces bulk editing capabilities, enabling you to apply changes to multiple text elements simultaneously. Whether annotating, modifying text, or linking variables, these changes are reflected across all selected elements, saving you time and ensuring consistency.


Core Features Retained and Improved:


  • Export/Import String Variables: Export your string variables to a spreadsheet-compatible format, make edits or translations, and import them back into Figma with ease.


  • Flexible Delimiter Support: Customizable delimiter options adapt to your preferred format, ensuring seamless integration with any spreadsheet software.


  • Preview Changes: Before finalizing imports, preview your changes in a tabular format, highlighting updated values for clarity.


  • Comprehensive Format Support: String-along continues to support a wide range of formatting options, including line breaks and punctuation, for versatile string management.
plugins.tagline: Complete suit of content management tools with full string variable support

plugins.name: Vector Blender
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that generates smooth transitions between two shapes by creating intermediate states.


Quick start

  1. Select the first shape
  2. Select the second shape (Please note that you don't need to multiple select)
  3. If the selected elements are supported types, you will see the indicator turn green
  4. Adjust the configuration, such as the number of elements and the layer order
  5. Generate elements


The plugin interpolates various properties including

  1. Position and size
  2. Rotation angles
  3. Fill colors and opacity
  4. Stroke colors and opacity
  5. Corner radius
  6. Vertex (for vectors)


Supported Shapes

  1. Vectors
  2. Line
  3. Rectangles
  4. Polygons
  5. Ellipses

plugins.name: Resize by Ratio
plugins.description:
Resize by Ratio is a plugin designed to simplify the process of resizing a node to fit a specific aspect ratio. It was created to address a frequent need in my work, where I often design for media with various ratios and different viewport sizes.


Supported Aspect Ratios:


  • 3:2
  • 2:3
  • 4:3
  • 3:4
  • 4:5
  • 5:4
  • 16:9
  • 9:16


Usage Instructions:

1.Select a single node of type rectangle, frame, or image.

2.Open the Resize by Ratio plugin.

3.Choose an anchor: width or height.

4.Select the desired aspect ratio.

5.Press RESIZE to modify the selected node.


This plugin is the work of a sole designer to address a specific need. I will keep an eye on comments and do my best to maintain and enhance the plugin over time. Thanks for viewing!

plugins.name: Blinko - Improve your eyesight and prevent eye strain in the blink of an eye!
plugins.description:
Meet Blinko! 👋🏻


Blinko is the first plugin for Figma and FigJam, designed with your health and productivity in mind. It helps improve your eyesight and prevent eye strain with just a few minutes of daily use.


How to use Blinko?

  1. In Figma or FigJam, go to the plugin menu and run the Blinko plugin
  2. Set a timer based on your availability
  3. Collapse the plugin
  4. When the time runs out, repeat the exercises and follow the instructions
  5. Take a 2-4 hour break between exercises
  6. Exercise three times a day regularly


Why use Blinko?

Blinko can help improve your vision and combat issues such as:

  1. Eye strain
  2. Burning eyes
  3. Headaches
  4. Blurred vision
  5. Difficulty focusing
  6. Sore eyes
  7. Eye twitching
  8. Double vision
  9. Tired eyes
  10. Dry eyes
  11. Itchy eyes

... and many other eye-related problems.


Unlock full power with Pro! 💎

Elevate your experience to the next level and unlock unlimited monthly uses. Get your Pro license here -> https://pro.blinko.io/


How to activate a Pro license?

  1. In Figma or FigJam, go to the plugin menu and run the Blinko plugin
  2. Click on the "Upgrade to Pro" button located at the top of the plugin
  3. Go to the "Activate your license key" section
  4. Paste your license key, and press the "Verify license" button

plugins.name: xliff-translate
plugins.description:
You know the situation, you have spent hours placing all text in Figma, arranged everything nicely, checked it several times with the people in charge, made the last corrections and everyone is happy and satisfied? Task accomplished! Then someone is asking for all the text you have in your Figma because it needs to be translated. Easy right?


If your translation service provider works with xliff, you now have a solution. With xliff-translate you can export all text layers to a file which then can be translated and if needed, imported again into Figma.


Features


You can choose to export a selection of layers, a page, or the entire document. __Note that the more layers you export, the longer it will take to process.__


If you have selected the entire document for export, you can decide whether to export the layers per page or all merged into the XLIFF document. Default is "merged".

Example. You have used the phrase "Hello World" on several pages. If you select the "Merge layers" option, this sentence will appear only once in the XLIFF document and will have to be translated only once. Without this option, the sentence will appear separately on each page on which it appears.


Locked and hidden layers are not exported by default.


In addition to the XLIFF document, you can also specify whether you want to export images. If this option is selected, you will receive a ZIP file containing the images and an XLIFF document. The outermost layer in which the text is located will be exported. For texts without surrounding elements on the page, no images will be exported.


Importing an XLIFF document is simple. Load it either by clicking the Import XLIFF button and selecting the file on your computer, or by dropping the file onto the Import button.

You can choose what happens if any text is not translated in the XLIFF document. Either this entry is ignored or the empty text is imported and the original text is deleted.


WARNING!!

If you have more than one text style in one text layer only the first style will be used for the imported text!
plugins.tagline: Export text from your Figma file to an easy-to-translate XLIFF document

plugins.name: Scoutr:Style Guides Generator
plugins.description:
Scoutr transforms your Figma design files into beautifully organized style guides instantly. Simply select your design elements, and watch as Scoutr automatically analyzes and generates a comprehensive style guide.


Key Features:

  1. Automatic color system analysis with semantic naming
  2. Typography styles documentation with live previews
  3. Shadow effects and gradients categorization
  4. Spacing (Auto-Layout) and radius system detection
  5. Support for px, dp, and pt units


How to Use:

  1. Select the layers or frames you want to analyze
  2. Choose your preferred unit (px/dp/pt)
  3. Click generate and get your style guide instantly!


Perfect for:

  1. Handoff documentation
  2. Design consistency check
  3. Quick style guide creation


Note: Works with any Figma design file. No setup or configuration needed.
plugins.tagline: One-click style guide wizard for your design ✨

plugins.name: Variable Scope Manager
plugins.description:
👋 What's this nifty plugin all about?

This plugin is your new best friend for managing variable scopes in Figma. It's designed to help you quickly filter, search, and modify the scopes of your local variables without breaking a sweat.


What can you do with it?

  1. Filter variables by type: Whether you're looking for NUMBER, COLOR, STRING this plugin's got you covered.
  2. Search like a pro: Need to find a specific variable? Just start typing, and the plugin will show you matching results in real-time.
  3. Bulk scope changes: Want to change the scopes for multiple variables at once? No problem! Search for the variables you want to modify, choose the new scopes, and voila!
  4. Quick overview: Get a bird's-eye view of all your variables, their types, and current scopes in one convenient list.


How to use it?

  1. Fire up the plugin
  2. Choose the variable type you want to work with
  3. Use the search box to filter the variables you want to edit
  4. Apply new scopes.


This plugin is perfect for keeping your variables organized and your workflow smooth. So go ahead, give it a spin, and take control of your Figma variables like never before! 🚀


Don't miss out on these other pro tools:


Variables everywhere

Quickly scan your selection for variables you actually forgot to apply


Brutal

A super light-weight plugin to remove, detach styles, variables etc
